Since the announcement of the pandemic by the World Health Organization (WHO), due to the worldwide spread of SARS-CoV-2, scientists have begun fast and detailed investigations on this coronavirus. The results achieved thus far show that SARS-CoV-2 displays a typical HCoVs structure, once its overall genome sequence, from samples of five patients, presented homology of about 79.5% to sequence of SARS-CoV 24, 25 and 50% to MERS-CoV genome.
10 Besides, it was verified 96% of likeness between SARS-CoV-2 genome and a CoV sampled from a Rhinolophus affinis bat (BatCoV RaTG13), which suggests bats act as intermediate hosts for SARS-CoV-2.
